data.title: Amazon's Next Step in Grocery Could Hit Walmart Where It Hurts
data.text: The e-commerce giant is planning a chain of brick-and-mortar stores that put online grocery orders first.

data.title: Big Tech is teaming up with health care companies to make it easier to see your health history
data.text: Apple, Amazon, Google and Microsoft's health teams were all represented at a meeting in Washington D.C. on Tuesday to discuss opening up access to patients' claims information.

data.title: Amazon, Walmart, Ikea targeted in University of California light bulb lawsuits
data.text: Five major retailers, including Amazon.com Inc and Walmart Inc, were sued on Tuesday by the University of California over what it called the "existential threat" when foreign manufacturers infringe schools' patents.

data.title: Amazon Offers A Rare Buying Opportunity
data.text: Amazon is giving the Justice Department hints about how it may answer any issues ahead of time. This is a smart strategy and should help lessen investor's fears.

data.title: Amazon launches personal styling service for Prime members
data.text: Amazon is continuing to build out its fashion business, adding a new personal styling service for Prime members Tuesday.

data.title: 3 of the Best AI Stocks to Buy Now
data.text: AI will impact us in ways we cannot yet imagine. And IBM, Amazon and Google stock are the easy winners from the advent of smarter machines.

data.title: Amazon says cloud unit AWS not compromised in Capital One hack
data.text: Amazon.com Inc  said on Tuesday its cloud unit was not compromised in any way by a former employee who hacked into Capital One Financial Corp  and obtained personal information including names and addresses of about 100 million individuals.

data.title: Will Capital One's 106M Name Data Breach Cut Into AWS's Growth?
data.text: #CapitalOneBreach could cost CapitalOne $150M but how much pain will it cause its customers and Amazon's AWS?

data.title: AWS follows Microsoft into the Middle East, opening new region in Bahrain
data.text: AWS, Amazon’s cloud arm, announced today that it has opened a Middle East Region in Bahrain. The Middle East is an emerging market for cloud providers and is this new region is part of a continuing expansion for the cloud giant.
